sense.name: compress out of shape or into small pieces
sense.examples: The car was crushed beyond recognition. Crush the asprin into a powder and mix with some applesauce. I've crushed my fingers in the door! They crushed as many people into the stands as they could.

sense.name: subdue, vanquish, obliterate
sense.examples: The government crushes anyone who dares to disagree. The Bears crushed the Lions, 28 to 0. We've come a long way in crushing racism. His resignation crushed all our hopes of reform. He crushed out the flames with his boot.

sense.name: oppress, overwhelm
sense.examples: She was crushed by the death of her son. If she says no to his invitation, it will crush him. They were crushed by debt.
